title: Add Bitcoin (BTC) address as a donation option on the landing page

requirements.text: Update the “Get Involved” section so the “Donate” option includes a Bitcoin (BTC) donation address as an additional donation method, displayed on the website.

quotes: Add btc address to donation option

acceptanceCriteria: On the landing page, the “Get Involved” section’s “Donate” option reveals BTC donation details (at minimum: a clearly labeled BTC address) in a way that is visible and readable on both mobile and desktop.
The BTC address is presented as copyable text (e.g., with a “Copy address” control) and provides user feedback after copying (e.g., “Copied”).
If a BTC address value is not yet configured in code, the UI does not display an invalid address; it shows a clear fallback message indicating the BTC address is not available yet.

requirements.text: Add an optional BTC QR code presentation for the configured BTC address within the donation UI (generated client-side) and ensure the donation UI is accessible.

quotes: Add btc address to donation option

acceptanceCriteria: When a BTC address is configured, the donation UI includes a scannable QR code representation of the BTC address (client-generated; no backend dependency).
All interactive elements in the donation UI are keyboard accessible and have appropriate accessible names/labels (e.g., for the copy control and any open/close controls if a modal/expander is used).
No backend canister changes are required to display the BTC donation information.

constraints: Frontend immutable paths must not be edited: frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, frontend/src/components/ui.
Do not route any images through the backend canister.
nonGoals: Implementing payment processing, checkout flows, or transaction verification.
Adding third-party donation providers, crypto wallet integrations, or external databases.
